Package de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.core

Interface CoreBatch

All Known Implementing Classes:
CoreBatchInternal
public interface CoreBatch
Interface for managing a "batch" of vertex data from a specific texture. The vertex data is accumulated via the addQuad(float, float, float, float, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, float, float, float, float) method. A batch can only hold so many quads; the canAddQuad() method should tell you when the batch is full. The amount of vertex data that a batch can hold is implementation-specific. Place initialization routines in begin(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.BlendMode, de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core.CoreTexture2D). When starting a new batch, you should call begin(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.BlendMode, de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core.CoreTexture2D) to initialize the batch before calling render().

    void
    render()
    Renders the batch's vertex data that was added with addQuad(float, float, float, float, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, float, float, float, float), using the blend mode and texture id specified in begin(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.BlendMode, de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core.CoreTexture2D).

  • Method Details

    • begin

      void begin(@Nonnull BlendMode blendMode, CoreTexture2D texture)
      Initializes the batch by specifying the blend mode and texture before a call to render().
      Parameters:
      blendMode - The BlendMode to render the batch with.
      texture - The texture that this batch's vertex data belongs to.

    • getBlendMode

      @Nonnull BlendMode getBlendMode()
      Gets the BlendMode that will be used to render this batch, that was specified in begin(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.BlendMode, de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core.CoreTexture2D).

    • render

      void render()
      Renders the batch's vertex data that was added with addQuad(float, float, float, float, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, de.lessvoid.nifty.tools.Color, float, float, float, float), using the blend mode and texture id specified in begin(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.BlendMode, de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core.CoreTexture2D).

    • canAddQuad

      boolean canAddQuad()
      A batch can only hold so many quads. This will tell you when the batch is full. The amount of vertex data that a batch can hold is implementation-specific.

    • addQuad

      void addQuad(float x, float y, float width, float height, @Nonnull Color color1, @Nonnull Color color2, @Nonnull Color color3, @Nonnull Color color4, float textureX, float textureY, float textureWidth, float textureHeight)
      Adds a quad to the batch for later rendering with render().
      Parameters:
      x - The top left coordinate of the quad, in screen coordinates.
      y - The top left coordinate of the quad, in screen coordinates.
      width - The width of the quad, in screen coordinates.
      height - The height of the quad, in screen coordinates.
      color1 - The color of the quad's first (top left) vertex.
      color2 - The color of the quad's second (top right) vertex.
      color3 - The color of the quad's third (bottom right) vertex.
      color4 - The color of the quad's fourth (bottom left) vertex.
      textureX - The first (top left) texture coordinate of the texture to map onto the quad.
      textureY - The first (top left) texture coordinate of the texture to map onto the quad.
      textureWidth - The width of the texture to map onto the quad.
      textureHeight - The width of the texture to map onto the quad.
      See Also:
      • canAddQuad()
